summary.long: 2 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To those who have obtained the same kind of faith as ours in the righteousness of our God and Savior, Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His divine power has given us everything we need for life and godliness through the knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and excellence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through these he has given us his precious and great promises so that through them you may share in the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that sinful lust causes in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, for this very reason, after applying every effort, add moral excellence to your faith. To moral excellence, add knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To knowledge, add self-control. To self-control, add patient endurance. To patient endurance, add godliness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To godliness, add brotherly affection. And to brotherly affection, add love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you have these qualities and they are increasing, they are going to keep you from being idle or unfruitful in regard to your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the person who lacks these qualities is shortsighted and, in fact, blind, because he has forgotten that he was cleansed from his old sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers, be more eager to make your calling and election sure for yourselves. For if you do these things, you will never stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, in this way you will be richly supplied with an entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I intend always to keep reminding you of these things, even though you already know them and are established in the truth you now have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I think it is right, as long as I am in this tent, to keep you wide awake by reminding you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I know that the putting off of my tent is going to happen soon, as our Lord Jesus Christ has made clear to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also make every effort so that after my departure you always have a reminder of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be sure, we were not following cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the powerful appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he received honor and glory from God the Father, when the voice came to him from within the Majestic Glory, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We heard this voice, which came out of heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also have the completely reliable prophetic word. You do well to pay attention to it, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the Morning Star rises in your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we know this above all else: No prophecy of Scripture comes about from someone’s own interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, no prophecy ever came by the will of man, but men spoke from God as they were being carried along by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were false prophets also among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought them, bringing swift destruction on themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will follow their depraved ways, and because of them the way of the truth will be blasphemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their greed they will exploit you with fabricated messages. Their condemnation announced long ago is not idle, and their destruction is not asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if God did not spare angels when they sinned but handed them over to chains of darkness by casting them into hell, to be kept under guard for judgment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if God did not spare the ancient world but preserved Noah, a preacher of righteousness, along with seven others when he brought a flood on the world of ungodly people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if God condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to destruction, by turning them into ashes when he made them an example of things to come for the ungodly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he rescued righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the unrestrained immorality of the wicked people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (while that righteous man was living among them, he was tormented in his righteous soul day after day by the lawless deeds he saw and heard);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation and to keep the unrighteous under guard until the day of judgment, in order to punish them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is especially true of those who follow the defiling lust of the flesh and who despise authority. Daring and arrogant, they do not tremble when they blaspheme glorious beings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas angels, even though they are greater in strength and power, do not bring a slanderous judgment against them before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these people blaspheme in matters about which they are ignorant, just like unreasoning creatures that live by instinct and are born to be captured and destroyed. So they too will be destroyed as a consequence of their destructive activity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be paid back for the harm they cause.
They consider it a pleasure to carouse in the daytime. They are spots and blemishes, who take delight in their deceitful pleasures while they feast with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have eyes full of longing for adulterous women and sins that never stop. They seduce unstable souls. They have trained their hearts for greed. They are children who are cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the right way and went astray, following the path of Balaam, son of Beor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (He was rebuked for his disobedience. A donkey, which does not talk, spoke with a human voice and restrained the prophet’s madness.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men are wells without water, clouds driven away by a windstorm, for whom the gloom of darkness has been reserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by uttering arrogant, empty words, they use the depraved lusts of the flesh to seduce those who are barely escaping from those who live in error.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they promise these people freedom, they themselves are slaves to corruption, for a person is a slave to what has control of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, if, after escaping the defiling things of the world through the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and controlled by them again, they are worse off than they were at first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy command passed on to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They demonstrate the truth of the proverb: “A dog returns to its own vomit,” and a washed sow returns to wallowing in the mud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, this is now the second letter that I have written to you. I wrote both of them to stir up your sincere mind with a reminder
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you to remember the words spoken earlier by the holy prophets and the command of the Lord and Savior through your apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First, know this: In the last days scoffers will come with their mocking, following their own lusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say, “Where is this promised coming of his? For from the time that our fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they have from the beginning of the creation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see, what they are intentionally forgetting is that the heavens came into existence long ago by the word of God and that the earth came together out of the water and between the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through these waters the former world perished, when it was flooded with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, by that same word, the heavens and earth have been stored up for fire, since they are being kept until the day of judgment and the destruction of the ungodly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not forget this one thing, dear friends: For the Lord, one day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is not slow to do what he promised, as some consider slowness. Instead, he is patient for your sakes, not wanting anyone to perish, but all to come to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. On that day the heavens will pass away with a roar, the elements will be dissolved as they burn with great heat, and the earth and what was done on it will be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since all these things will be destroyed, what kind of people ought you to be, living in holiness and godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you look forward to and hasten the coming of the day of God? That day will cause the heavens to be set on fire and destroyed, and the elements to melt as they burn with great heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But according to his promise we look forward to new heavens and a new earth, in which righteousness dwells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, dear friends, as you look forward to these things, make every effort to be found in peace, spotless and blameless in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Regard the patience of our Lord as salvation, just as also our dear brother Paul wrote to you, according to the wisdom that was given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke about these things the same way in all of his letters. There are some matters that are hard to understand in his letters, which the ignorant and unstable distort, as they also do with the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, dear friends, since you already know these things, be on your guard so that you do not fall from your own firm position by being led astray through the error of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory, both now and forever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
